Description: Rim and shoulder sherd (mended from three fragments) of East Greek (North Ionian?) Middle Wild Goat I pottery dinos; interior: streaky band painted at top of sherd; exterior, white slipped: part of a dog to right facing perhaps a grazing wild goat to left (neck part-preserved?); filling ornaments: pendant half-rosette and pendant roundel; top of shoulder and underside of rim glazed; on upper surface of rim band of ovules. Pinkish red clay with grey core; some mica and white inclusions.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.028)
